definition: theatrical work (play, opera, TV series etc)/dramatic (change, increase etc)/acute/severe
to do/to grow/to write or compose/to pretend/to regard as/to feel/writings or works

home/family/(polite) my (sister, uncle etc)/classifier for families or businesses/refers to the philosophical schools of pre-Han China/noun suffix for a specialist in some activity, such as a musician or revolutionary, corresponding to English -ist, -er, -ary or -ian/CL:個|个[ge4]

sentences.english: French playwright, journalist and feminist Olympe de Gouges is guillotined.
sentences.chinese: 法国剧作家，记者，女权主义者，被处斩。

sentences.english: The playwright cocooned himself in a world of pretence.
sentences.chinese: 这个剧作家与世隔绝，生活在一个虚幻的世界里。

sentences.english: Strindberg also demands that the naturalist playwright strive toward a new conception of character.
sentences.chinese: 斯特林还要求自然剧作家争取一个新的概念，性质。

sentences.english: Xia Yan is a modern playwright.
sentences.chinese: 夏衍是现代著名的剧作家。

sentences.english: U8 :It goes without saying that Shakespeare overshadows all the other playwrights through the ages.
sentences.chinese: 毫无疑问，莎士比亚使各个时代的剧作家相形见绌。

sentences.english: From those proceeds dramatists were paid to write new plays.
sentences.chinese: 有了这些收益，剧作家写新剧就有了报酬。

sentences.english: Only when he began to work as a playwright did his fortunes improve.
sentences.chinese: 一直到他开始当剧作家时，命运才得到改善。

sentences.english: Time has devalued his stature as a play writer.
sentences.chinese: 随着时光的流逝，他作为剧作家的地位下降了。

sentences.english: Shakespeare was a well-known playwright in the history of English literature.
sentences.chinese: 莎士比亚是英国文学史上一位著名的剧作家。

sentences.english: Screenplay writers definitely read everything with a different perspective than the rest of us.
sentences.chinese: 剧作家随便读什么东西，视角肯定是跟咱们不一样的。

sentences.english: The dramatist wrote up a story idea in the form of a one-act play.
sentences.chinese: 剧作家把情节大意写成了一个独幕剧。

sentences.english: As a playwriter,Shakespeare belongs to the 16th century.
sentences.chinese: 作为一位剧作家，莎士比亚属于16世纪。

sentences.english: The playwrights are sure-handed enough to turn out top-drawer scripts.
sentences.chinese: 这些剧作家足够自信可以写出顶级的剧本。

sentences.english: Moliere, the French playwright wrote a play called Tartuffe.
sentences.chinese: 法国剧作家莫里哀写了一本剧作《答尔丢夫》。

sentences.english: The playwright borrowed the essence of plot from Shakespeare.
sentences.chinese: 剧作家借用了莎士比亚戏剧的情节的精华。

definition: School of Minor-talks, one of the Hundred Schools of Thought 諸子百家|诸子百家[zhu1 zi3 bai3 jia1] during the Warring States Period (475-221 BC)
Henrik Ibsen (1828-1906), Norwegian dramatist, author of Doll's House 玩偶之家
Anton Pavlovich Chekhov (1860-1904), Russian writer famous for his short stories and plays
Shakespeare/slang or popular culture abbr. of 莎士比亞|莎士比亚[Sha1 shi4 bi3 ya4]

pinyin: Wei1 lian2 · Sha1 shi4 bi3 ya4

definition: Molière (1622-1673), French playwright and actor, master of comedy
